title.narrative: SAFE WATER FACILITIES

description.narrative: Improved availability of affordable, sustainable safe water supply facilities in vulnerable areas, schools and health facilities by 2018., which contributes to Hygiene, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Target population in conflict-affected, underserved, and epidemic-prone communities in South Sudan have improved access to equitable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services by 2018.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved availability of affordable, sustainable safe water supply facilities in vulnerable areas, schools and health facilities by2018.

description.narrative: Despite the evolving situation in the country and the ongoing insecurity, UNICEF reached 224,221 people across the country, who benefitted from safe water through new construction, rehabilitation or upgrading of water facilities in communities, schools, and health and nutrition centres, as well as urban water systems. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Number of people accessing a sustainable drinking water service in the reporting year only
of WASHCOM established in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
